Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/lluunn>@lluunn</denchmark-link> , I'd like to say that I bumped into very similar problems while writing the config file, which is tailored towards running on existing kubernetes clusters. For example, I changed minio and mysql to use a default storage class. Because of that, I propose using the existing_arrikto config file, with the following procedure: # Apply Istio kubectl apply -f deployment/existing/istio # Deploy for existing K8s kfctl init --config=bootstrap/config/kfctl_existing_arrikto.0.6.yaml kfctl generate k8s kfctl apply k8s

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> see my comments in in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3627>#3627</denchmark-link> about the use cases I think we want to support.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lluunn>@lluunn</denchmark-link> I think I found the problem now: <denchmark-code>create Pod nbserver-0 in StatefulSet nbserver failed error: pods "nbserver-0" is forbidden: error looking up service account kubeflow/default-editor: serviceaccount "default-editor" not found </denchmark-code>
Those seem to be set in file components/profile-controller/pkg/controller/profile/profile_controller.go. I wonder should that be executed with the kfctl_k8s_istio config?
minio and mysql comes from kustomize overlay. Ideally, it should use PVC and default storage class. Any reason it use a separate PV there?
